newsitem.title: INDIA: India cotton mixed on rains, cyclonic storms.
newsitem.headline: India cotton mixed on rains, cyclonic storms.

text.p: Indian cotton prices were mixed on Thursday due to unseasonal rains and a cyclone that was due to hit the west coast later in the day, dealers said.

They said Punjab varieties fell while prices gained in Gujarat in India's western region. Punjab cotton however attracted offerings at high levels on reports of 17,000-18,000 bales (170 kg each) in the Punjab region, against the daily average of 8,000-10,000 bales last week.
In spot deals Bengal-deshi fell by 40/50 to 960/1,020 rupees per maund while Punjab saw-ginned fell 10/25 to 1,625/1,700. Gujarat Sankar-4 however rose by 300 rupees to 20,600/21,300.
